    version: 0.9

    Position

    A collection of utility classes to position content.

    Usage

    To apply this component, add one of the .position-* classes to a block element. When using this component to place content on top of an image, add the .inline class from the Utility component to a container element around the image and the element to create a position context.

    Note This is often used to position an overlay from the Overlay component. Use the .light or .dark class from the Inverse component to apply a light or dark color for better visibility.

    Class Description
    .position-top Positions the element at the top.
    .position-left Positions the element at the left.
    .position-right Positions the element at the right.
    .position-bottom Positions the element at the bottom.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    Top
    Bottom
    Left
    Right
    
									<div class="position-relative margin-medium">
										<div class="inline margin">
											<img src="/assets/images/photos/image1.webp" width="1800" height="1200" alt="">
											<div class="position-top overlay text-center">Top</div>
											<div class="position-bottom overlay text-center">Bottom</div>
											<div class="position-left overlay flex flex-middle">Left</div>
											<div class="position-right overlay flex flex-middle">Right</div>
										</div>
									</div>

    X and Y directions

    You can also apply more specific positions that won't spread over one side of the parent container by adding one of the following classes.

    Class Description
    .position-top-left Positions the element at the top left.
    .position-top-center Positions the element at the top center.
    .position-top-right Positions the element at the top right.
    .position-center Positions the element vertically centered in the middle.
    .position-center-left Positions the element vertically centered on the left.
    .position-center-right Positions the element vertically centered on the right.
    .position-bottom-left Positions the element at the bottom left.
    .position-bottom-center Positions the element at the bottom center.
    .position-bottom-right Positions the element at the bottom right.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    Top Left
    Top Center
    Top Right
    Center Left
    Center
    Center Right
    Bottom Left
    Bottom Center
    Bottom Right
    
									<div class="inline">
										<img src="/assets/images/photos/image1.webp" width="1800" height="1200" alt="">
										<div class="position-top-left">
											<div class="overlay">Top Left</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-top-center">
											<div class="overlay">Top Center</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-top-right">
											<div class="overlay">Top Right</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-center-left">
											<div class="overlay">Center Left</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-center">
											<div class="overlay">Center</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-center-right">
											<div class="overlay">Center Right</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-bottom-left">
											<div class="overlay">Bottom Left</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-bottom-center">
											<div class="overlay">Bottom Center</div>
										</div>
										<div class="position-bottom-right">
											<div class="overlay">Bottom Right</div>
										</div>
									</div>

    Cover

    If you want a position element to cover its container, just add the .position-cover class.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Cover
    
									<div class="position-relative margin-medium">
										<div class="inline">
											<img src="/assets/images/photos/image1.webp" width="1800" height="1200" alt="">
											<div class="position-cover overlay flex flex-center flex-middle">Cover</div>
										</div>
									</div>

    Outside

    There are two classes to center elements outside on the left and right of the parent container. This is useful to position the Slidenav component outside of a Slideshow or Slider component.

    Class Description
    .position-center-left-out Positions the element vertically centered outside on the left.
    .position-center-right-out Positions the element vertically centered outside on the right.

    Note Once the outside positioned element sticks out of the viewport to the right, it will cause a horizontal scrollbar. Use the Visibility component to hide the outside positioned element on a smaller viewports and show an inside positioned element instead.

    
						<div class="position-center-left-out"></div>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    Out
    Out
    
									<div class="position-relative margin-medium">
										<div class="inline">
											<img src="/assets/images/photos/image1.webp" width="1800" height="1200" alt="">
										
											<div class="position-center-left-out visible@s">
												<div class="overlay">Out</div>
											</div>
											<div class="position-center-right-out visible@s">
												<div class="overlay">Out</div>
											</div>
										</div>
									</div>

    Margin Offsets

    Margin offset classes apply consistent spacing around absolutely positioned elements. They also define the --position-margin-offset custom property, which is used by center-aligned positioning utilities (e.g., .position-center) to prevent edge overflow.

    Class Description
    .position-small Applies a small margin.
    .position-medium Applies a medium margin
    .position-large Applies a large margin
    .position-xlarge Applies an extra large margin

    Utility classes

    This component features a number of general position utility classes:

    Class Description
    .position-relative Add this class to apply relative positioning.
    .position-absolute Add this class to apply absolute positioning.
    .position-fixed Add this class to apply fixed positioning.
    .position-z-index Add this class to apply a z-index of 1.
